column5: Jacob Norman McDonald was born on Monday night at approx 10:10pm. For those of you who understand he has double right ventricle ateries. Which is both great arteries come out of the right ventricle instead of one right and one left. He also hase a sizeable hole between the ventricles. But all said he came home from Sick Kids last night and is doing great. His heartrate, breathing, and oxygen levels are normal. He will have to go for surgery in four to six months. He has to have check-ups every two weeks in the meantime. We're just so happy to have him home and doing so good. Very excited. Oh by the way he weighed 8lbs even. With lots of hair.  Thanks for reading.  Curt

Congratulations of the birth of your Son, that's the best thing that can happen to a family !!  Best of luck with his health issues too, but there's no better place in the country than Sick Kids and their the ones who can & will take care of him.
Thanks Lew. Sick Kids have alot of really awesome people working there.   Curt
Congrats to you and your wife, Curt. That's wonderful news. As for the health issues, Jacob couldn't be in better hands.
Congrats on the arrival of your son. The child is in good hands. The cardio team is second to none at Sick Kids.
Congratulations on the arrival of your son.  Best wishes for his future treatment as well, he is in good hands.
great news!!!!  congrats!  Cheers!
Good to hear Curt Congratulations on the arrival of Jacob. Hope to see pictures soon
Congratulations! Great news, and I am glad he is home where he belongs. I am with the others as far as Sick Kids goes. Best wishes! Jim
Hey Curt congratulations to you and your wife glad to here every thing is going good let see some pictures of baby Jacob  Rob
Very cool indeed.  Great pics I hope he is fine.  Praying for the doctors when they perform the surgery. I think babies are the best things ever even if they keep us up at night.
Great pics and CONGRATS to all. All will be good,he,s in the best care. My prayers are with you and  family ,and JACOB.

Congrats on the new arrival Curt!!  My neice had the same problems when she was born. Sick kids took excellent care of her, and she's now 100% fine. Shes a bit of a handful.....but health wise, absolutly perfect!!!  I'm sure the surgery will go just fine. Those people at sick kids are miracle workers for sure!!!!  Sinker
He certainly looks like he's raring to go! Your older one is a real combo eh?

Congrats and God bless. Just to put you mind at ease, my son was born with very similar heart defects. At six months old he had heart surgery at Sick kids, this was back in 1999 he is now 9 years old and nothing can stop him. All the best
Congratulations!  Best wishes to all of you and as many have said, good people at Sick Kids.
Looks like a strong team all around!  Congrats!!  Sick kids has been very good to us.  Congrats again!!

congradulations on your new arrival, sick kids is second to no one in pediatric care, they truly signafy the way health care should be, my 13 year old daughter had surgery there 7 months ago, and knowing she was been taken care of by the most caring, sincere group of professionals in their field helped to lessen the stress associated with the surgery.
Thanks for the nice comments.  Curt
congrats!  Great looking family.  All the best!  Cheers.
